## Discussion

Every physics body in a scene can be assigned to one or more categories, each corresponding to a bit in the bit mask. You define the mask values used in your game. # categoryBitMask

**Instance Property**

A mask that defines which categories this physics body belongs to.

## Declaration

```swift
var categoryBitMask: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

Every physics body in a scene can be assigned to one or more categories, each corresponding to a bit in the bit mask. You define the mask values used in your game. Use this property together with the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsBody/physicsShape] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsBody/contactTestBitMask] properties to define which physics bodies interact with each other and when your game is notified of interactions.

The default value is [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsCollisionCategory/static] for static bodies and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsCollisionCategory/default] for dynamic and kinematic bodies.

## Working with Contacts and Collisions

- **contactTestBitMask**: A mask that defines which categories of bodies cause intersection notifications with this physics body.
- **collisionBitMask**: A mask that defines which categories of physics bodies can collide with this physics body.
- **SCNPhysicsCollisionCategory**: Default values for a physics body’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsBody/categoryBitMask] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsBody/collisionBitMask] properties.
- **continuousCollisionDetectionThreshold**: The minimum distance the body must travel for SceneKit to apply a more precise (but more costly) algorithm to detect contacts with other bodies.
